result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:07 AM Defendant George G Johnson in court.  Attorney Jason Matthew Lockery in court for George G Johnson.  Attorney Craig Lambert in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Lambert states they are still waiting for test results from State Crime Lab. Parties are requesting another FPT in 60 days.
Court grants adjournment. If tests are not back by next FPT, matter will be set for trial. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on October 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:24 AM Defendant George G Johnson in court.  Attorney Jason Matthew Lockery in court for George G Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State has filed a motion for joinder. Attorney Lockery does not object.
Court grants motion for joinder. Bond is continued.
Motion hearing on September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
To Join Cases for Trial

State's Motion in Limine for the Introduction of Other Acts Evidence

9:28 AM Defendant George G Johnson in court.  Attorney Jason Matthew Lockery in court for George G Johnson.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has filed a motion for a return of property. Attorney Oswald is now not objecting to the return of the vehicle. He states what his initial concerns were.
Court grants motion to return property.
of George Johnson
Vehicle Title
Defendant's Notice of Motion Hearing & Motion for Return of Property Seized

2:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Nathan T. Oswald appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant George G Johnson appeared by video, Attorney Jason Matthew Lockery for George G Johnson appeared in court. 

Detective Brian Machon is sworn and questioned by Attorney Oswald.  Testifies that on 2/16/22 he executed a search warrant. Testifies the defendants, Brown and Johnson, were at the residence.  Witness reviews the defendant on the video screen.  Testifies to finding multiple items of contraband in the residence.  Testifies to testing the substance which tested positive for the presence of cocaine.  Testifies to determining that the amount found to not be for personal use.  Testifies to the amount of cash located. Testifies to locating firearms in the residence.  Cross-examination by Attorney Grubofski.  Questions witness regarding the location of where the items were found in the bedroom.  Cross-examination by Attorney Lockery.  

Court takes judicial notice of prior convictions of defendant Johnson.

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
